title: Drawing, "Teapot, Hot Water Pitcher, Milk Pitcher and Sugar Bowl", ca. 1825
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: The Cooper Union Museum (Lugt 457c)
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Probably made of cut glass, opal, and hyalite. Captions written in ink, above: Vergoldter thee Service / No5. Thee Kanne.; above, tea pot; center left, cream pot; center right, milk pot. Captions: Schmetenkanne und Milchdriigl. Bottom, sugar bowl, caption: Zukerdose.; handles are shown at right. The decorations consist mainly of a row of ovoidal holes with beads inside, around the bodies.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Teapot, Hot Water Pitcher, Milk Pitcher and Sugar Bowl", ca. 1825.
ca. 1825. Brush and watercolor, graphite on cream paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-735.
